title: Arca Sends 1.49M ARB to Binance, Losing $465K
author: Steven Walgenbach
excerpt: Lookonchain, the on-chain tracking platform, revealed in an X (formerly Twitter) post earlier today that the investment firm Arca sent a substantial amount of Arbitrum (ARB) to Binance a few hours ago. According to the post, Arca sent 1.49 million ARB tokens, valued at $1.21 million, to the leading cryptocurrency exchange platform.

title: BTC Could Crash to $12,000, Do You Believe This Will Happen?
author: Chryzano Ariston
excerpt: Crypto Youtuber Crypto Rover expressed his unbelief in a prediction made by Capo. Capo’s prediction forecasted that Bitcoin would drop to $12,000 before spiking again. This meant that BTC could break the support level at $25,200 and thereafter break the support at $19,000-$20,000 before reaching the $12,000 level. It could have either been his expert technical knowledge or his strong faith in BTC that could have created this unbelief in Rover.

title: Charles Hoskinson Unveils Update in Cardano Governance Model
author: Abdulrasaq Ariwoola
excerpt: Days after he was called out for stagnating and slowing down development on the Cardano blockchain, Charles Hoskinson, Cardano founder, in a recent livestream, unveiled updates to the ecosystem that would supposedly chart it towards a more decentralized path.

title: Fantom’s Ambitious Plans: Messari Report Highlights Upgrades
author: Abdulrasaq Ariwoola
excerpt: A recent report by market intelligence platform Messari detailed developments on Layer-1 blockchain Fantom. According to Messari, Fantom “is well poised to continue driving network adoption” through its plans laid out for the rest of the year.

title: Crypto Prices Today: XRP, MATIC & BLUR Face Big Weekly Losses
author: Danielle du Toit
excerpt: Over the past week, some of the most well-known cryptocurrencies like Ripple (XRP) and Polygon (MATIC) have been underperforming when compared to some of the other big names in the industry. Additionally, Blur (BLUR), the native token of the Blur NFT marketplace has also taken a few hits.

title: SEC Responds to Coinbase’s Rulemaking Petition; Details Remain Shrouded
author: Veronica Genegaling
excerpt: Coinbase’s Chief Legal Officer, Paul Grewal, revealed that the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has communicated with the Third Circuit regarding Coinbase’s rulemaking petition, marking progress in their legal dispute. However, the details of the SEC’s response remain vague, causing concern.

title: ARK Investment Submits Revised Bitcoin Spot ETF Prospectus
author: Nynu V Jamal
excerpt: American asset management company ARK Investment Management LLC submitted an amendment to the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), flagging the potential Bitcoin spot ETF approval. According to a recent post on X (formerly Twitter) by Eric Balchunas, the Senior ETF Analyst at Bloomberg, the firm has presented a substantial update to its spot bitcoin ETF prospectus, addressing various topics that the regulators previously asked the ETF issuers to talk about.

title: Japan Launches Digital Currency To Process Clean Energy Certificates
author: Ross
excerpt: According to a news report from Reuters, crypto exchange DeCurret announced on October 12 that a group of Japanese companies, including Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, Mizuho Financial Group, and Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, will band together to launch a digital currency by July 2024. This currency will be utilized for the exchange and settlement of clean energy certificates.

title: Solana Flips ADA and Captures Spot on CoinMarketCap Trending List
author: Danielle du Toit
excerpt: Solana (SOL) hit CoinMarketCap’s trending list after it was able to flip Cardano (ADA) in the market cap race. After surpassing ADA in market cap, SOL was trading hands at $21.77 at press time, after its price slipped by 2% in the past 24 hours of trading.

title: The US Has Lost Its Way in Digital Assets Regulation: Lawyer
author: Ikemefula Aruogu
excerpt: Ripple’s General Counsel, Stuart Alderoty, thinks the United States has lost its way in digital assets regulation. According to him, the US lost its way by allowing politics and power to be elevated over sound policy, meaning the country has various agencies fighting over control rather than satisfying the right policy outcome.
